page.title: 01SHERBORNE AND WINDRUSH
page.content: Our 3x4km.block is in the county of Gloucestershire,in a valley of the Cotswold hills.It is approx 23km S.E. of Cheltenham, which is the nearest large town.It is just north of the A40 Cheltenham to Oxford road,between Northleach and Burford. The area contains the village of Sherborne and most of the village of Windrush.These villages are situated in the valley of the Sherborne brook and the River Windrush.Most of Sherborne is fields and pasture,with trees dotted around.Some of the fields are used for growing cereal crops,usually wheat and barley.There is the Sherborne Park which is a big country estate.It originally belonged to Sherborne House but it now belongs to the National Trust.Part of another large Estate, Barrington Park comes into the block.
